Major_Arcs.title: The Ghost Town Mystery and Airport Conflict
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces the mysterious 'Ghost Town' setting and the central conflict of a woman's displacement in time, intertwined with modern plans to build an airport, threatening the historical integrity of the town.

sub_scenes.title: Arrival and Explanations in Ghost Town
sub_scenes.description: A woman finds herself in a Western town and desperately tries to explain her unbelievable situation, related to time travel, to skeptical men in various locations within the town.

narrative_arcs.title: Arrival and Explanations in Ghost Town

sub_scenes.title: Discovery of Airport Plans and Confrontation
sub_scenes.description: The woman, reflecting on her arrival in Ghost Town, overhears men discussing plans to build an airport, which horrifies her due to her deep connection to the town's historical value. She confronts them, leading to a clash of perspectives.

narrative_arcs.title: Discovery of Airport Plans and Confrontation in Ghost Town

Major_Arcs.title: Relationship Dynamics and the Real Offer
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc shifts to relationship dynamics between the Woman in Green Hat (Nan) and Cal, exploring romantic misunderstandings, past hurts, and Cal's redirection of their conversation towards a 'real offer' in the 'blasted desert', hinting at deeper, perhaps business-related, intentions.

sub_scenes.title: Romantic Notions and Internal Reflection
sub_scenes.description: The woman and Cal discuss their relationship, clearing up romantic misunderstandings. The woman reflects on past emotional pain caused by Cal, contrasting her current understanding with past hurts.

sub_scenes.title: The Real Offer in the Blasted Desert and Work Site Encounter
sub_scenes.description: Cal dismisses their argument and directs the woman's attention to the 'blasted desert', hinting at a significant offer. They move to a work site in the desert where the woman encounters construction workers, leading to a tense interaction.

narrative_arcs.title: The Real Offer in the Blasted Desert
Arrival at the Work Site and Confrontation with Workers

Major_Arcs.title: Airport Business and Family Drama
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc shifts to the airport business plan and its implications, introducing new characters like Nan and her father. It explores the practicalities of horse transportation for the airport construction, family disagreements over the airport development, and emotional distress within Nan's family.

sub_scenes.title: Horse Transportation and Airport Plans
sub_scenes.description: Characters discuss plans to transport horses by air from the airport under construction, focusing on logistical and financial aspects. Nan expresses frustration about the airport and wishes her father would focus on cattle business instead.

sub_scenes.title: Conflict over Helping Construction Workers and Family Reprimand
sub_scenes.description: The woman in the green hat discusses helping construction workers by renting horses. Simultaneously, Nan is reprimanded by her father for her 'crazy notions' of helping, possibly the same construction workers, leading to escalating family conflict and emotional distress.

narrative_arcs.title: Helping Construction Workers and Crazy Notions
Solace in Tears and Maid's Comfort

Major_Arcs.title: Relationship Advice and Confrontation
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on advice given to Nan regarding her relationship with Cal and her emotional turmoil. It leads to Nan confronting Cal, demanding clarity, and then pursuing him, highlighting her emotional urgency and need for resolution.

sub_scenes.title: Mother and Maid's Advice
sub_scenes.description: Nan receives comforting and practical advice from her mother and maid about love, patience, and understanding Cal's actions as expressions of love rather than words.

narrative_arcs.title: Mother's Advice on Love and Patience
Maid's Practical Advice and Cal's Love

sub_scenes.title: Confrontation and Chase for Answers
sub_scenes.description: Nan, influenced by the advice and her own need for clarity, confronts Cal, demanding to know the truth about their relationship. When he seems to leave, she chases after him on horseback, desperate for answers.

narrative_arcs.title: Desperate Chase and Plea for Attention

Major_Arcs.title: Balancing Business and Confession
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc interweaves the practicalities of the horse business and airport deadline with Nan and Cal's relationship. It leads to Cal confessing his feelings after Nan's pursuit, resolving their emotional tension amidst the backdrop of business obligations.

sub_scenes.title: Airport Deadline and Business Commitment
sub_scenes.description: The focus shifts back to the urgent matter of getting horses to the airport due to a tight deadline. Nan and Cal discuss a business deal made by her father, emphasizing their commitment to it despite personal drama.

narrative_arcs.title: Yore Dad's Deal and No Backing Down

sub_scenes.title: Departure, Flashback, and Confession of Feelings
sub_scenes.description: Cal departs to attend to his work, leaving Nan. A flashback reveals Nan's loneliness during Cal's past absences. Cal then returns, confessing he followed her to finally express his long-held feelings.

Major_Arcs.title: Love, Weather Crisis, and Community Aid
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc explores the deepening relationship between Nan and Cal amidst a severe snowstorm. It depicts their affection juxtaposed with the growing threat of the weather crisis, culminating in the community receiving aid via 'Operation Hay Lift', blending romance with external challenges.

sub_scenes.title: Affection and Foreboding
sub_scenes.description: Nan and Cal express their affection, but a narrator hints at underlying tension in their 'armed truce' relationship, foreshadowing potential conflict.

sub_scenes.title: Arrival, Weather Report, and Relentless Snowfall
sub_scenes.description: Mr. Wills arrives with a grim weather report, detailing severe snow conditions. Inside, the severity of the weather and its impact on livestock feed are discussed, revealing growing worry about the relentless snowfall.

sub_scenes.title: Decision to Act and Arrival of Aid
sub_scenes.description: Cal decides to gather men to address the weather crisis threatening their cattle. Despite initial despair about the unending snowfall, hope arrives with the sound of a plane bringing 'Operation Hay Lift' aid, signifying community relief.

narrative_arcs.title: Sound of Hope: Arrival of the Plane

Major_Arcs.title: Cowtown Showdown and Differing Perspectives
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc shifts to a new setting in a 'Cowtown' and introduces Chane Benson through a public fight. It explores varied perspectives on Benson's character, from admiration to criticism and a more mature, nuanced view, setting up character dynamics and potential conflicts.

sub_scenes.title: Public Showdown and Initial Reactions
sub_scenes.description: Chane Benson is showcased in a public fight, knocking a man down in the street. Townspeople react, with varied responses from intrigue to gossip, setting the stage for different opinions on Benson.

sub_scenes.title: Jeff and Sally's Critical Opinions
sub_scenes.description: Jeff and Sally discuss Chane Benson, with Jeff criticizing Benson's manners and motivations, while Sally and an older man offer more mature perspectives on Benson's behavior and potential for growth.

narrative_arcs.title: Jeff's Critical Opinion of Chane Benson
Sally and Older Man's More Mature Perspective on Chane Benson

Major_Arcs.title: Family Dynamics, Gun Violence, and Benson's Threat
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc explores family dynamics through Sally and Jeff's relationship and Jeff's hero worship of his brother, Clyde. It escalates into a confrontation involving guns and Benson's growing threat to Clyde, leading to a dinner invitation with sinister undertones.

sub_scenes.title: Gun Handling and Escalating Argument
sub_scenes.description: Sally questions Jeff's gun handling and his idolization of his brother, Clyde. Their conversation escalates into a heated argument with Jeff implying violent consequences inspired by Clyde, alarming Sally.

narrative_arcs.title: Reflecting on Past Hero Worship and Questioning Gun Handling

sub_scenes.title: Reassurance and Benson's Storytelling
sub_scenes.description: Sally expresses her fear about Jeff's behavior. Clyde reassures her and commits to changing Jeff. Mr. Benson is introduced, beginning a suspenseful story about 'Chane Benson' and a dangerous atmosphere.

narrative_arcs.title: Reassurance and Commitment to Change Jeff
Introduction of Mr. Benson and Storytelling

sub_scenes.title: Accusation, Warning, and Benson's Declaration
sub_scenes.description: Sally confronts Clyde about an article, which he denies writing. Sally warns Clyde about the danger of Benson. Clyde dismisses her fears, but Benson interjects, reassuring them and declaring his intent to fight the 'killers' in town, misleadingly presenting himself as an ally.

narrative_arcs.title: Confrontation and Denial about the Article
Benson's Declaration to Stay and Fight Killers

sub_scenes.title: Escalating Threats and Dinner Invitation
sub_scenes.description: Benson's enforcer threatens Surrett. Despite warnings, Clyde publishes articles against Benson. Jeff's companion shifts her opinion of Benson, leading to a dinner invitation intended for conciliation, but with Jeff misinterpreting the situation.

narrative_arcs.title: Clyde's Defiant Articles and Public Reaction

sub_scenes.title: Dinner's End and Benson's Aggression
sub_scenes.description: The dinner with Benson concludes with polite interactions masking underlying tension. Jeff confronts his sister, while Benson reveals sinister intentions. Benson then forcefully kisses Jeff's sister, leading to an angry confrontation and revelation of her protective motives.

narrative_arcs.title: End of Dinner and Moonlight Charm

Major_Arcs.title: Confrontation, Chase, and Showdown with Benson
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc depicts the escalation of conflict with Benson from verbal to physical violence. Jeff is assaulted, leading to a chase and a final showdown where Jeff confronts Benson to protect Clyde, culminating in Benson's retreat.

sub_scenes.title: Escalating Violence and Chase
sub_scenes.description: Verbal confrontation between Benson and Jeff escalates into physical assault. Benson punches Jeff, then boasts about his dominance and threatens Clyde. Jeff's sister rushes to his aid as Benson rides off towards town, pursuing Clyde.

sub_scenes.title: Resolution and Aftermath
sub_scenes.description: The standoff between Jeff and Benson is resolved as Benson retreats. Jeff and Clyde reflect on the tension, and Jeff expresses remorse for past actions. The community finds relief in Benson leaving town, and the newspaper team works late to report the news, finding unity in their profession.

narrative_arcs.title: Resolution of the Standoff and Benson's Departure
Reflecting on Tension and Expressing Remorse
Headline Change, Relief, and Newspaper Work

Major_Arcs.title: Range War and Betsy's Firm Stance
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces a new conflict – a range war – and new characters, Betsy and Steve. It depicts escalating tensions due to the range war, Betsy hiring Steve as a bodyguard, and her firm stance against violence despite the escalating threats and provocations.

sub_scenes.title: Initial Confrontation and Bodyguard Introduction
sub_scenes.description: A tense confrontation between cowboys sets the scene. Hank Galloway introduces Steve Daley as Betsy's new bodyguard, hinting at impending danger and the need for protection.

narrative_arcs.title: Introduction of Steve Daley as Bodyguard

sub_scenes.title: Clarifying Steve's Role and Range War Discussion
sub_scenes.description: Hank clarifies Steve's role as Betsy's bodyguard. Betsy expresses concern about the range war, and Hank details deliberate acts of sabotage, blaming 'Double-K', escalating tensions and justifying the need for protection.

narrative_arcs.title: Discussion of Range War and Underlying Troubles

sub_scenes.title: Store Visit, Daley's Observation, and Confrontation
sub_scenes.description: Betsy and Steve visit a store. Steve deliberately observes Steve Daley. They encounter Fred Bridges and his men, leading to a tense confrontation and a sudden physical altercation, highlighting the ongoing range war conflict.

narrative_arcs.title: Departure from the Store and Daley's Observation
Confrontation with Fred Bridges and Hired Hand
Observations on Steve's Skills and Impending Danger

sub_scenes.title: Betsy's Decision and Steve's Offer of Love
sub_scenes.description: Betsy decides to keep Steve as her bodyguard but under the condition he gives up gunslinging. Maverick observes Betsy, misinterpreting her actions as romantic interest. Steve then offers to give up his gun for Betsy after she confesses her love, leading to a romantic resolution.

narrative_arcs.title: Maverick's Observation and Question to Betsy
Hank Defends Steve and Maverick's Suggestion
Steve's Dilemma and Betsy's Confession of Love
Steve's Ultimate Proof of Love and Betsy's Acceptance

sub_scenes.title: Renewed Conflict and Betsy's Justification of Violence
sub_scenes.description: Old Man Bridges complains about ongoing trouble, leading to a confrontation with Hank over trespassing accusations. Betsy, despite Steve giving up his gun, prepares for violence, justifying it as necessary due to escalating threats and recounting a past ambush to Steve.

narrative_arcs.title: Bridges Confronts Hank and Accuses Trespassing
Betsy and Steve Prepare for Confrontation
Betsy Justifies Gun Violence as Necessary
Betsy Recounts the Ambush and Loss of Horses
Aftermath of the Ambush and Hank's Escape

sub_scenes.title: Ultimatum and Betsy's Journey to Devil's Pass
sub_scenes.description: Betsy resolves to use guns, leading to an argument with Steve, who gives her an ultimatum. Despite this, Betsy proceeds with her plan to go to Devil's Pass, driven by her resolve and memories, while Steve reflects on her decision.

narrative_arcs.title: Ride to Devil's Pass and Gunfire Encounter

sub_scenes.title: Devil's Pass Confrontation and Reconciliation
sub_scenes.description: At Devil's Pass, Steve warns of danger. A gunfight ensues, and Betsy is injured. In the aftermath, Steve and Betsy reconcile, reaffirm their love, and find hope amidst the violence.

narrative_arcs.title: Arrival at Devil's Pass and Warning

Major_Arcs.title: Carrie, Dave, and Fred: Love, Deception, and Reconciliation
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces a love triangle between Carrie, Dave, and Fred Gordon, complicated by business deals and deception. It explores Carrie's shifting feelings, her confrontation with Fred, and ultimately leads to a complex reconciliation and marriage proposal, though built on potentially shaky foundations.

sub_scenes.title: Disagreement and New Threat
sub_scenes.description: A woman (Rancher's Daughter - Carrie) argues with Dave about leaving, while in another scene, concern arises about Curley's behavior and the threat posed by Bear Fenin acquiring the Bar C ranch.

narrative_arcs.title: Concern over Curley and Bear Fenin's Threat

sub_scenes.title: Fence Confrontation and Expulsion
sub_scenes.description: The rancher and his daughter discover a fence cutting off their cattle's water. They confront Fred Gordon, leading to escalating tension and the rancher expelling Fred and his men from their range.

sub_scenes.title: Past Apologies and Unexpected Encounter with Fred
sub_scenes.description: Carrie reflects on past apologies and lingering resentment towards Fred Gordon. Despite attempts to make amends, negative feelings persist. An unexpected encounter with Fred disrupts a moment between Carrie and Dave.

narrative_arcs.title: Reflecting on Past Apologies and Lingering Resentment
Carrie's Reluctance to Discuss Fred and Preference for Dave

sub_scenes.title: Sarcastic Confrontation and Movie Invitation
sub_scenes.description: Fred Gordon confronts Carrie, demanding she leave Dave alone. A sarcastic exchange ensues, followed by a tentative truce and an unexpected movie invitation, hinting at a shift in their dynamic.

narrative_arcs.title: Initial Confrontation and Demand to Leave Dave Alone
Reflection on Love and a Marriage Proposal

sub_scenes.title: Realization of Deception and Business Meeting
sub_scenes.description: Carrie realizes Fred's proposal was a trick to secure the Carlton contract and confronts him. Despite his justifications, Carrie feels deceived. Later, a business meeting is set up, with Dave's unexpected arrival adding tension.

narrative_arcs.title: Realization of Deception and Contract Motive
Night of Reflection and Business Meeting

sub_scenes.title: Carlton's Office Confrontation and Surrender
sub_scenes.description: Carrie confronts Mr. Carlton about his manipulative tactics regarding the contract. Despite Carlton's defense, Carrie asserts her independence and, surprisingly, appears to surrender to Fred, creating ambiguity about her true intentions.

sub_scenes.title: Angry Farewell and Confession of Love to Dave
sub_scenes.description: Carrie angrily bids farewell to Fred. Later, she meets Dave and confesses her love for Fred, surprising and leaving Dave stunned. A flashback reveals her father's advice and Carrie's initial prideful refusal to admit her feelings.

sub_scenes.title: Illness, Revelation, and Joyful Reunion
sub_scenes.description: Carrie falls ill, and Mr. Carlton reveals to her father and Dave that Fred turned down the beef contract, acting honorably. Dave confesses this truth to Carrie, leading to her realizing her mistake and joyfully riding to Fred for a romantic reunion and proposal.

narrative_arcs.title: Carrie's Shame, Regret, and Joyful Ride

Major_Arcs.title: Chris, Dirk, and Rance: Injury, Arrest, and Love Triangle Resolution
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on Chris, Dirk, and Rance, introducing a new love triangle amid a conflict involving injury, arrest, and escape. It explores Chris's divided loyalties, leading to a violent confrontation, Dirk's escape, and ultimately, Chris choosing love with Rance.

sub_scenes.title: Injured Dirk Seeks Help and Bullet Wound Diagnosis
sub_scenes.description: Dirk, injured, seeks Chris's help. A flashback shows a prior meeting between them. A doctor examines Dirk and confirms he has a bullet wound, shocking Chris and setting up the medical crisis.

narrative_arcs.title: Past Encounter - Dirk and Chris Meet

sub_scenes.title: Investigation and Ranch Search
sub_scenes.description: Concerned about Dirk, Chris's father plans to investigate. Marshal Rance Cready arrives, revealing he is trailing Dirk and intends to search the ranch, leading to a confrontation with Chris over his authority.

narrative_arcs.title: Concern for Dirk and Investigation Plan
Sheriff Arrives and Identifies Chris & Dirk's Trail

sub_scenes.title: Arrest and Plea for Delay
sub_scenes.description: Marshal Cready interrogates Chris and reveals Dirk is wanted for murder. Chris pleads for a delay due to Dirk's injuries, and Marshal Cready, showing compassion, agrees to stay and guard Dirk until he recovers.

narrative_arcs.title: Plea for Delay and Conditional Stay

sub_scenes.title: Confession, Escape Plan, and Arrest
sub_scenes.description: Chris confesses her love for Marshal Cready, creating a complex emotional dynamic. Despite this, she plans Dirk's escape. However, Marshal Cready arrests Dirk, fulfilling his duty despite personal feelings.

sub_scenes.title: Pursuit, Shooting, and Escape to Mexico
sub_scenes.description: Dirk escapes with help, but they are pursued. A flashback reveals their evasion attempts. A confrontation ensues, and Chris is accidentally shot. They flee towards Mexico, with Dirk ensuring Chris's safety across the border.

narrative_arcs.title: Fleeing the Scene and Bandaging Wounds
Escape to Mexico and Criminal Escape

sub_scenes.title: Chris's Return, Rance's Injury, and Uncertain Reunion in Mexico
sub_scenes.description: Chris decides to return to Rance, confessing her love to Dirk. Rance is revealed to be injured and angry. Chris expresses concern for him, but Rance directs her away from him and towards Dirk in Mexico, yet the final panel shows Chris in Mexico, suggesting an uncertain reunion.

narrative_arcs.title: Return to Rance and Confession of Love
Concern for Rance and Separate Paths
Arrival in Mexico and Uncertain Reunion

sub_scenes.title: Rance's Recovery and Marriage Proposal Resolution
sub_scenes.description: Rance recovers from unconsciousness, with Chris tending to him. Chris confesses her love again, leading to Rance proposing marriage, resolving their romantic conflict amidst the legal and moral complexities of Dirk's situation.

narrative_arcs.title: Inquiry About Business and Father's Opinion

sub_scenes.title: Wedding Preparations and Dirk's Return
sub_scenes.description: Chris reflects on her marriage plans, expressing lingering fears about Dirk. The wedding day dawns, and as the ceremony begins, Dirk unexpectedly returns, disrupting the wedding and creating a final moment of tension.

narrative_arcs.title: Vows and Fears Before the Wedding

sub_scenes.title: Final Resolution and Dirk's Acceptance
sub_scenes.description: Dirk's disruptive arrival leads to a brief confrontation and explanation of his capture being planned. Dirk accepts his fate, even humorously acknowledging his captor as 'best man', ultimately leading to a peaceful resolution and the wedding proceeding.

narrative_arcs.title: Backstory of the Man and Rance's Support
